headline: Team Leader, Medicinal Chemistry, Modality Platform Technologies at GSK

message.text: I’m happy to share that I’m starting a new position as Team Leader, Modality Platform Technologies (Medicinal Chemistry) at GSK!

I'm grateful to Harry Kelly for nominating me in the Rising Star category at the Targetjobs graduate recruitment awards, which I was fortunate to win a few weeks ago. Thanks too to my supportive current and former GSK colleagues, to whom the credit should go. Congratulations to Harry for his second place award in the Early Years Professional of the Year category.
Opportunity to join a great team!

ingestedContentSummary.fullText: The Modality Platform Technologies group specialises in the design and development of novel approaches for the synthesis of a range of molecular classes including oligonucleotides, targeted protein degraders and antibody drug conjugates to accelerate drug discovery. The team brings together medicinal chemistry, synthetic organic chemistry and automation skills and experience to deliver industry leading platforms, uniting science, technology, and talent to get ahead of disease together. We create a place where people can grow, be their best, be safe, and feel welcome, valued, and included. We offer a competitive salary, an annual bonus based on company performance, healthcare and wellbeing programmes, pension plan membership, and shares and savings programme. Discover more about our company wide benefits and life at GSK on our webpage Life at GSK | GSK In this role you will Carry out experimental work within the Modality Platform Technologies group. This will involve designing and executing synthetic plans to deliver small quantities of compound for biological evaluation. In addition to the laboratory component of this role, this will also involve analysing data, and designing compounds to test medicinal chemistry hypotheses. In contrast to using synthetic organic chemistry to discover new reactions or methodology, this role will involve applying synthesis to discover compounds with improved biological activity. Develop and implement strategies for efficient and high-quality synthesis, purification, and characterization of challenging molecular scaffolds. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to apply our innovative modalities platforms to the discovery of new therapeutics. Stay up to date with the latest advancements in chemistry and technologies aligned to the group remit and evaluate their potential applications in the discovery of therapeutics. Why you? Basic Qualifications & Skills: We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals: Very good degree or equivalent in chemistry and a PhD/DPhil (or about to be awarded a PhD) in medicinal chemistry/synthetic chemistry/chemical biology. Good track records working in the lab A sound understanding of practical organic chemistry and current synthetic methodology is an essential requirement as shown by an extensive track record of high synthetic productivity, route design and problem solving. Evidence of applying innovative synthetic chemistry to solve problems is required. Ability to understand, interpret and communicate complex scientific data. Excellent written and oral communication skills enabling efficient presentation of scientific findings to both technical and non-technical audiences. Track record of peer reviewed publications. A record of presenting at scientific meetings is also expected. Preferred Qualifications & Skills: Please note the following skills are not necessary, just preferred, if you do not have them, please still apply: An awareness and understanding of medicinal chemistry principles and their use within a drug discovery setting Design, implement and problem solve as appropriate, with minimal supervision Knowledge of therapeutic applications of oligonucleotides, antibody drug conjugates, targeted protein degraders and the drug development process Attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment Closing Date for Applications – 18 April 2024 (COB) Please take a copy of the Job Description, as this will not be available post closure of the advert. When applying for this role, please use the ‘cover letter’ of the online application or your CV to describe how you meet the competencies for this role, as outlined in the job requirements above. The information that you have provided in your cover letter and CV will be used to assess your application. At GSK, we have bold ambitions for patients, aiming to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people over the next 10 years. R&D is committed to discovering and delivering transformational vaccines and medicines to prevent and change the course of disease. Science and technology are coming together in a way they never have before, and we have strong tech-enabled capabilities that allow us to build a deeper understanding of the patient, human biology and disease mechanisms, and transform medical discovery. We are revolutionising the way we do R&D. We’re uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together. Find out more: Our approach to R&D. Why Us? GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organization where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of 2030. Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a workplace where everyone can feel a sense of belonging and thrive as set out in our Equal and Inclusive Treatment of Employees policy.
